I read the original article and thread about novelty search and found it ve=
ry interesting. It would be interesting to hear if there are better insight=
s about the idea now.
In particular I want to understand how is the novelty=
 search better than a systematic or a random search of the genotype space. =
A brute force search of the genotype will certainly run on many occasions i=
nto the same phenotypes. The question is to what extent can novelty search =
avoid this and does it have other benefits?

ps.
I attended Ken's tutorial =
on developmental systems on GECCO2008, and in my opinion, it was by far the=
 best presentation I saw on that conference. That's how I got introduced to=
 NEAT. Now I decided to take a look at it again and I am finding many inter=
esting ideas.
